history.proof: intros x. destruct x as [m b]. destruct b; auto. - sfirstorder depth: 3. - sfirstorder depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
mon n * bool -> bool

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
CoefStructure : forall (A : Set) (A0 : A), A -> forall eqA : A -> A -> Prop, (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A) -> Prop
OrderStructure : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> (A -> A -> A) -> Prop
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d
pair : ?A -> ?B -> ?A * ?B where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) |- Type]
inleft : ?A -> ?A + {?B} where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) |- Prop]
right : ?B -> {?A} + {?B} where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) |- Prop]
inright : ?B -> ?A + {?B} where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) |- Prop]
left : ?A -> {?A} + {?B} where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->...-> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) |- Prop]
divTerm : Term A n -> forall b : Term A n, ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b -> Term A n
M1_min : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x : A, ~ ltM x M1
ltM_nonrefl : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x : A, ~ ltM x x
mkOrderStructure : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), (forall x : A, ~ ltM x M1) -> (forall x : A, ~ ltM x x) -> transitive A ltM -> well_founded ltM -> (forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM x z) (plusM y z)) -> (forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM z x) (plusM z y)) -> OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM
ltM_plusr : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM x z) (plusM y z)
ltM_plusl : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> forall x y z : A, ltM x y -> ltM (plusM z x) (plusM z y)
ltM_trans : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> transitive A ltM
ltM_wf : forall (A : Set) (M1 : A) (ltM : A -> A -> Prop) (plusM : A -> A -> A), OrderStructure A M1 ltM plusM -> well_founded ltM
multTerm : forall A : Set, (A -> A -> A) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Term A n -> Term A n
zeroP : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Prop
plus_minus_le : forall a b : nat, a - b + b = a -> b <= a
mdiv_div : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), mdiv d b a -> mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b = a
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
div_clean_dec2 : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), (let (_, b0) := div_mon_clean d a b in b0) = false -> mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b <> a
div_clean_dec1 : forall (d : nat) (a b : mon d), (let (_, b0) := div_mon_clean d a b in b0) = true -> (let (m, _) := div_mon_clean d a b in m) = div_mon d a b /\ mult_mon d (div_mon d a b) b = a
ppcm_mom_is_ppcm : forall (d : nat) (a b c : mon d), c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c a) a -> c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c b) b -> c = mult_mon d (div_mon d c (ppcm_mon d a b)) (ppcm_mon d a b)
well_founded : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Prop
Inductive sumor (A : Type) (B : Prop) : Type := inleft : A -> A + {B} | inright : B -> A + {B} Arguments sumor (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inleft {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inright {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
transitive : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope

```coq
intros x. destruct x as [m b].
destruct b; auto.
Qed.```

original: intros x. destruct x as [m b]. destruct b; auto.
